description: Ground floor extension to side of works building for extension to existing vehicle repair workshop
decision_conditions: The car parking spaces shown on the approved plan C01.187.04 single parking arrangement only in line with alterations to be agreed by condition 4, shall be used for storage of cars only and no work including maintenance and repairs, shall be carried out on vehicles except for within the existing workshop building.  REASON:  To ensure there is adequate provision for storage of cars within the site and in the interests of the living conditions of nearby occupiers, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies T31, T58, B5, B8, ES5, Replacement UDP Policies 9.1, 9.11. 4.1, 4.11. | No vehicles in control of the applicant shall park or be worked upon within a 2 miles radius of the site.  REASON:  In the interests of highway safety and to protect the living conditions of nearby residents, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies T9, B5, ES5, Replacement UDP Policies 9.1, 9.11. 7.8, 4.11. | Any machinery audible outside the premises must be designed to an acoustic standard not exceeding Noise Rating NR35 measured or calculated at the nearest horizontal or vertical boundary of the nearest affected dwelling, whichever is the closer.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B5, B8, ES5, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1, 4.11. | Details of how the proposed disabled parking parallel to the carriageway, can be accommodated within the building, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing within 1 month of the date of this decision.  Details so approved shall be implemented like so and permanently retained.  REASON:  In the interests of highway safety, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted PoliciesT12, T63, Replacement UDP Policies 9.5, 9.11. | Detailed drawings of pedestrian visibility splays measuring 1.5m by 1.5m with no obstruction more than 0.6m high on both sides of the egress, which should be physically protected from being walked over and shown on the deposited plans shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority within 1 month from the date of this permission.  Details so approved shall be implemented like so and permanently retained.  REASON:  In the interests of highway safety, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies T12, T63, Replacement UDP Policies 9.5, 9.11.
